snippet: The country’s move to establish a national minimum wage offers the United States important lessons, if only lawmakers in Washington would learn.
abstract: Editorial notes Germany, in voting to set minimum wage of 8.5 euros an hour, joins other European countries in having higher minimum wages than United States; holds vote sets solid wage floor that is not dependent on collective bargaining between unions and employers, and will aid in stabilizing nation economically and socially; holds Germany's move offer US important lessons.
lead_paragraph: The country’s move to establish a national minimum wage offers the United States important lessons, if only lawmakers in Washington would learn.
